propositions.text: A female forensic pathologist named Zita is involved in solving a murder case in Singapore.
On November 13, 2005, a female body was discovered in a park, with initial death time estimated between 10 PM and 11 PM.
Zita receives a late-night call from an old classmate, Lin Kai, who seeks her help with a case.
Zita agrees to meet Lin Kai to discuss the case details over dinner.
Zita encounters an unexpected incident on her way to meet Lin Kai.
Zita is accidentally knocked down by a young man while walking to the meeting.
During the meeting at a café, Lin Kai reveals he is investigating a serial murder case.
Lin Kai suspects the park murder on January 13 is linked to previous cases and seeks Zita’s forensic expertise.
Zita agrees to assist by providing detailed autopsy reports.
Zita discovers new clues in the autopsy report that could aid the investigation.
Zita finds traces of soil in the victim’s fingernails, suggesting a struggle at the crime scene.
She informs Lin Kai, who plans to re-examine the park for further evidence.

concepts.name: Forensic Pathology
concepts.context: Central to Zita’s role in analyzing murder cases through autopsies.

concepts.name: Murder Case
concepts.context: The primary focus of the narrative involving a series of killings.

concepts.name: Serial Killer
concepts.context: Lin Kai’s suspicion about the nature of the murders.

concepts.name: Autopsy Report
concepts.context: Critical document used by Zita to uncover clues.

concepts.name: Crime Scene
concepts.context: Location of the murder where evidence is collected.

hierarchy.structure: The document is structured as a narrative with chapters focusing on a forensic investigation intertwined with personal interactions and past connections.
